content: We saw continued strong demand for our front cabin, with North America Premium Cabin PRASM, up 37% for the quarter versus 2019. On the cost side, our second quarter non-fuel costs, excluding non-recurring items, totaled $491 million, with unit costs up 16% compared to 2019, which was at the better end of our expectations. Please proceed with your question. Please proceed with your question. But I do think that this industry has proven resilient over time, particularly in the United States of being able to adjust and adapt, maybe not always as quickly as people would like quarter-to-quarter, but over a period of time, you see supply and demand fall into balance and strategies emerge to be able to develop different revenue sources and different cost savings opportunities. Please proceed with your question. Please proceed with your question.
